meanings.definition: A device that increases the pressure of a gas or liquid.
meanings.sent1: The pressurizers in the lab help make sure the chemicals mix correctly.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic used the pressurizers to inflate the car tires.
meanings.sent3: The pressurizers at the soda factory never get tired of squeezing those bubbles in.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a set of powerful pressurizers, pushing her towards success.
meanings.sent5: The pressurizers hummed softly as they worked, like diligent little helpers.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that applies pressure to something.
meanings.sent1: The pressurizers in the kitchen made sure the meat was cooked evenly.
meanings.sent2: The pressurizers in the factory ensured the molds were perfectly shaped.
meanings.sent3: The pressurizers in the gym were the trainers who pushed everyone to their limits.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as emotional pressurizers, making her feel trapped.
meanings.sent5: The pressurizers of time never stop, always pushing us forward.

meanings.sent1: The pressurizers of the scuba tank kept the diver safe underwater.
meanings.sent2: The pressurizers of the paint gun made sure the color sprayed evenly.
meanings.sent3: The pressurizers of the balloon party were the kids blowing up balloons non-stop.
meanings.sent4: The pressurizers of competition drove the athletes to perform their best.
meanings.sent5: The pressurizers of nature can be felt in the strong winds of a storm.
